str2: If. A primary particle of conditionality; if, whether, that, etc.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: To do, perform, accomplish; be in any condition, i.e. I fare; I exact, require.
Willing, willingly, voluntarily. Of uncertain affinity; voluntary.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: To have, hold, possess. Including an alternate form scheo skheh'-o; a primary verb; to hold.
(a) pay, wages, salary, (b) reward, recompense, punishment. Apparently a primary word; pay for service, good or bad.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.
If. A primary particle of conditionality; if, whether, that, etc.
Unwilling, generally used where English would express by an adverb: unwillingly. Unwilling.

parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Middle or Passive - 1st Person Singular
str2: From pistis; to have faith, i.e. Credit; by implication, to entrust.
Management of household affairs, stewardship, administration. From oikonomos; administration; specially, a 'economy'.
